sub_topic: Determining the rank of a matrix
message_1:
The following matrix A represents the ages of 5 people in a certain community:
 
A = 
\begin{bmatrix}
    22 & 35 & 28 & 19 & 25 \\
    30 & 22 & 27 & 23 & 26 \\
    29 & 35 & 31 & 28 & 24 \\
    19 & 20 & 21 & 22 & 23 \\
\end{bmatrix}

Determine the rank of matrix A.
message_2:
To determine the rank of matrix A, we need to perform Gaussian elimination to find the row echelon form of the matrix. 

Step 1: Swap row 1 and row 4 to have the smallest element in the first row:

\begin{bmatrix}
    19 & 20 & 21 & 22 & 23 \\
    30 & 22 & 27 & 23 & 26 \\
    29 & 35 & 31 & 28 & 24 \\
    22 & 35 & 28 & 19 & 25 \\
\end{bmatrix}

Step 2: Eliminate the elements below the first pivot (19):

Row 2 = Row 2 - (30/19) * Row 1
Row 3 = Row 3 - (29/19) * Row 1
Row 4 = Row 4 - (22/19) * Row 1

\begin{bmatrix}
    19 & 20 & 21 & 22 & 23 \\
    0 & -8.6316 & 1.8421 & -1.3158 & -1.2105 \\
    0 & 16.3684 & -2.8421 & 2.3158 & -2.7895 \\
    0 & 12.1053 & 1.1579 & -8.6842 & -1.7895 \\
\end{bmatrix}

Step 3: Swap row 2 and row 4 to have the smallest element in the second row:

\begin{bmatrix}
    19 & 20 & 21 & 22 & 23 \\
    0 & 12.1053 & 1.1579 & -8.6842 & -1.7895 \\
    0 & 16.3684 & -2.8421 & 2.3158 & -2.7895 \\
    0 & -8.6316 & 1.8421 & -1.3158 & -1.2105 \\
\end{bmatrix}

Step 4: Eliminate the elements below the second pivot (12.1053):

Row 3 = Row 3 - (16.3684/12.1053) * Row 2
Row 4 = Row 4 - (-8.6316/12.1053) * Row 2

\begin{bmatrix}
    19 & 20 & 21 & 22 & 23 \\
    0 & 12.1053 & 1.1579 & -8.6842 & -1.7895 \\
    0 & 0 & -4.9999 & 10.9997 & -0.9997 \\
    0 & 0 & 3.0001 & -5.0003 & 0.0003 \\
\end{bmatrix}

Step 5: Swap row 3 and row 4 to have the smallest element in the third row:

\begin{bmatrix}
    19 & 20 & 21 & 22 & 23 \\
    0 & 12.1053 & 1.1579 & -8.6842 & -1.7895 \\
    0 & 0 & 3.0001 & -5.0003 & 0.0003 \\
    0 & 0 & -4.9999 & 10.9997 & -0.9997 \\
\end{bmatrix}

Step 6: Eliminate the elements below the third pivot (3.0001):

Row 4 = Row 4 + (4.9999/3.0001) * Row 3

\begin{bmatrix}
    19 & 20 & 21 & 22 & 23 \\
    0 & 12.1053 & 1.1579 & -8.6842 & -1.7895 \\
    0 & 0 & 3.0001 & -5.0003 & 0.0003 \\
    0 & 0 & 0 & 0.9999 & -0.9996 \\
\end{bmatrix}

Now, we have the row echelon form of matrix A. Since all rows have non-zero pivots, the rank of matrix A is 4.
